<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 3px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 245px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p756 ft22">sextionde dagen efter dagen för deponeringen av det sextionde instrumentet avseende ratificering, godtagande, godkännande eller anslutning hos Förenta nationernas general- sekreterare.</P>
<P class="p1049 ft22">2. För en stat som ratificerar, godtar, godkänner eller ansluter sig till denna stadga efter deponeringen av det sextionde instrumentet avseende ratificering, godtagande, godkännande eller anslutning träder stadgan i kraft den första dagen i den månad som följer efter den sextionde dagen efter den dag då staten i fråga deponerade sitt instrument avseende ratificering, godtagande, godkännande eller anslutning.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 54px;margin-top: 20px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Artikel 127</P>
<P class="p1039 ft26">Frånträde</P>
<P class="p1090 ft149"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft167">En stadgepart får genom skriftlig underrättelse till Förenta nationernas generalsekreterare frånträda denna stadga. Frånträdet träder i kraft ett år efter den dag då underrättelsen har mottagits, såvida inte ett senare datum anges i underrättelsen.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1107 ft149"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft189">En stat skall på grund av sitt frånträde inte vara befriad från de förpliktelser den har iklätt sig genom denna stadga när den var</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_513" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 49px 0px 80px 77px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 547px;">


<DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 4px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 208px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p1164 ft22">to the Statute, including any financial obligations which may have accrued. Its withdrawal shall not affect any cooperation with the Court in connection with criminal investigations and proceedings in relation to which the withdrawing State had a duty to cooperate and which were commenced prior to the date on which the withdrawal became effective, nor shall it prejudice in any way the continued consideration of any matter which was already under consideration by the Court prior to the date on which the with- drawal became effective.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 54px;margin-top: 38px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Article 128</P>
<P class="p1325 ft26">Authentic texts</P>
<P class="p1025 ft22">The original of this Statute, of which the Arabic, Chinese, English, French, Russian and Spanish texts are equally authentic, shall be deposited with the <NOBR>Secretary-General</NOBR> of the United Nations, who shall send certified copies thereof to all States.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 56px;margin-top: 19px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft149">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned, being duly authorized thereto by their respective Governments, have signed this Statute.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 5px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 194px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p1083 ft22">stadgepart i stadgan, däribland eventuella ekonomiska skyldigheter som kan ha uppstått. Frånträdet skall inte inverka på något samarbete med Domstolen i samband med brottsutredningar, förundersökningar och förfaranden med avseende på vilka den frånträdande staten var skyldig att samarbeta och vilka har inletts före den dag då från- trädet trädde i kraft; frånträdet skall inte heller på något sätt inverka på den fortsatta behandlingen av någon fråga som var under behandling av Domstolen före den dag då det trädde i kraft.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 53px;margin-top: 21px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Artikel 128</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 47px;margin-top: 2px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Giltiga texter</P>
<P class="p1040 ft22">Originalet till denna stadga, vars arabiska, engelska, franska, kinesiska, ryska och spanska texter är lika giltiga, skall deponeras hos Förenta nationernas generalsekreterare, som skall tillställa alla stater bestyrkta kopior därav.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 42px;margin-top: 36px;margin-bottom: 0px;text-indent: 19px;" class="ft149">Till bekräftelse härav har undertecknade, därtill vederbörligen bemyndigade av sina respektive regeringar, undertecknat denna stadga.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 145px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 4</P>
<P class="p885 ft2">513</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>

	<TD class="tr5 td262"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 4</P></TD>

<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 7px;margin-top: 732px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">514</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 6px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 153px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft149">Upprättad i Rom den 17 juli 1998.</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV id="page_515" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 49px 0px 80px 68px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 556px;">


<DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 1px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 405px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft1">Romstadgan artiklarna 8:2 e (xiii) – (xv)</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 151px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 5</P>
<P style="text-align: right;padding-right: 51px;margin-top: 739px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">515</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_516" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 794px;height: 1122px;">

<DIV style="position:absolute;top:0px;left:0px;z-index:-1;width:794px;height:1122px;">
<IMG src="http://data.riksdagen.se/fil/H103146/H103146517x1.jpg" style="width:794px;height:1122px;">
</DIV>


</DIV>
<DIV id="page_518" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 44px 0px 80px 40px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 584px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 492px;font: 20px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td153"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td248"><P class="p13 ft1">Romstadgan artiklarna 8 <SPAN style="font: italic 20px 'Times New Roman';line-height: 22px;">bis</SPAN>, 15 <SPAN style="font: italic 20px 'Times New Roman';line-height: 22px;">bis </SPAN>och 15 <SPAN style="font: italic 20px 'Times New Roman';line-height: 22px;">ter</SPAN></P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td153"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 6</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td248"><P style="font: 1px 'Times New Roman';line-height: 18px;" class="p13">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 9px;margin-top: 729px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">516</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_519" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 794px;height: 1122px;">
<DIV style="position:absolute;top:0px;left:0px;z-index:-1;width:794px;height:1122px;">
<IMG src="http://data.riksdagen.se/fil/H103146/H103146519x1.jpg" style="width:794px;height:1122px;">
</DIV>


</DIV>
<DIV id="page_520" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 794px;height: 1122px;">
<DIV style="position:absolute;top:0px;left:0px;z-index:-1;width:794px;height:1122px;">
<IMG src="http://data.riksdagen.se/fil/H103146/H103146520x1.jpg" style="width:794px;height:1122px;">
</DIV>


</DIV>
<DIV id="page_521" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 794px;height: 1122px;">
<DIV style="position:absolute;top:0px;left:0px;z-index:-1;width:794px;height:1122px;">
<IMG src="http://data.riksdagen.se/fil/H103146/H103146521x1.jpg" style="width:794px;height:1122px;">
</DIV>


</DIV>
<DIV id="page_522" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 49px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 68px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 556px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 2px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 411px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft1">Brottskriterierna (Elements of Crimes)</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 18px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">Bilagan återger de s.k. Brottskriterierna (Elements of Crimes) som stadgepartsförsamlingen enligt art. 9 i Romstadgan har antagit (se avsnitt 9.1.6). Brottskriterierna har ännu inte översatts till svenska.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 145px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 29px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 624px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p317 ft23">Innehåll</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">General Introduction …………………………………………………65</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 171px;margin-top: 3px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">Article 6: Genocide……………………………………………………67 Article 7: Crimes against humanity…………………………………..70 Article 8: War Crimes…………………………………………………82</P>
<P class="p256 ft23">General introduction</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Pursuant to article 9, the following Elements of Crimes shall assist the Court in the interpretation and application of articles 6, 7 and 8, consistent with the Statute. The provisions of the Statute, including article 21 and the general principles set out in Part 3, are applicable to the Elements of Crimes.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">As stated in article 30, unless otherwise provided, a person shall be criminally responsible and liable for punishment for a crime within the jurisdiction of the Court only if the material elements are committed with intent and knowledge. Where no reference is made in the Elements of Crimes to a mental element for any particular conduct, consequence or circumstance listed, it is understood that the relevant mental element, i.e., intent, knowledge or both, set out in article 30 applies. Exceptions to the article 30 standard, based on the Statute, including applicable law under its relevant provisions, are indicated below.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 17px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Existence of intent and knowledge can be inferred from relevant facts and circumstances.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">With respect to mental elements associated with elements involving value judgement, such as those using the terms ”inhumane” or ”severe”, it is not necessary that the perpetrator personally completed a particular value judgement, unless otherwise indicated.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">Grounds for excluding criminal responsibility or the absence</SPAN></P>
<P class="p312 ft4">thereof are generally not specified in the elements of crimes listed under each crime. <A href="#page_522"><SPAN class="ft90">238</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The requirement of ”unlawfulness” found in the Statute or in other parts of international law, in particular international humanitarian law, is generally not specified in the elements of crimes.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 171px;margin-top: 9px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft50">238 </SPAN>This paragraph is without prejudice to the obligation of the Prosecutor under article 54, paragraph 1, of the Statute.</P>
<P class="p318 ft2">519</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_523" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 51px 0px 79px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 41px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 583px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 122px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 461px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p859 ft4">7. The elements of crimes are generally structured in accordance with the following principles:</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 28px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;text-indent: -28px;" class="ft22"><SPAN style="font: 12px 'Arial';line-height: 15px;">−</SPAN><SPAN class="ft226">As the elements of crimes focus on the conduct, consequences and circumstances associated with each crime, they are generally listed in that order;</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 28px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;text-indent: -28px;" class="ft22"><SPAN style="font: 12px 'Arial';line-height: 15px;">−</SPAN><SPAN class="ft226">When required, a particular mental element is listed after the affected conduct, consequence or circumstance;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p118 ft2"><SPAN style="font: 12px 'Arial';line-height: 15px;">−</SPAN><SPAN class="ft200">Contextual circumstances are listed last.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p178 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">8.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">As used in the Elements of Crimes, the term ”perpetrator” is neutral as to guilt or innocence. The elements, including the appropriate mental elements, apply mutatis mutandis to all those whose criminal responsibility may fall under articles 25 and 28 of the Statute.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p267 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">9.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">A particular conduct may constitute one or more crimes.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">10.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft154">The use of short titles for the crimes has no legal effect.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p436 ft23">Article 6</P>
<P class="p91 ft26">Genocide</P>
<P class="p89 ft3">Introduction</P>
<P class="p734 ft2">With respect to the last element listed for each crime:</P>
<P class="p897 ft22"><SPAN style="font: 12px 'Arial';line-height: 15px;">−</SPAN><SPAN class="ft210">The term ”in the context of” would include the initial acts in an emerging pattern;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p118 ft2"><SPAN style="font: 12px 'Arial';line-height: 15px;">−</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 17px;line-height: 15px;">The term ”manifest” is an objective qualification;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p897 ft149"><SPAN style="font: 12px 'Arial';line-height: 15px;">−</SPAN><SPAN class="ft235">Notwithstanding the normal requirement for a mental element provided for in article 30, and recognizing that knowledge of the circumstances will usually be addressed in proving genocidal intent, the appropriate requirement, if any, for a mental element regarding this circumstance will need to be decided by the Court on a </SPAN><NOBR>case-by-</NOBR> case basis.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;margin-top: 26px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 6 (a)</P>
<P class="p91 ft26">Genocide by killing</P>
<P class="p89 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p646 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator killed </SPAN><A href="#page_523"><SPAN class="ft32">239</SPAN></A>one or more persons.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 17px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such person or persons belonged to a particular national, ethnical, racial or religious group.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 44px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 624px;overflow: hidden;">
<P style="text-align: right;padding-right: 164px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft41"><SPAN class="ft50">239 </SPAN>The term ”killed” is interchangeable with the term ”caused death”.</P>
<P class="p1739 ft2">520</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_524" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 79px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td102"><P class="p13 ft2">3.</P></TD>
	<TD style="padding: 0px;margin: 0px;width: 392px;vertical-align: bottom;" class="tr6"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator intended to destroy, in whole or in part, that</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">national, ethnical, racial or religious group, as such.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr17 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td102"><P class="p13 ft2">4.</P></TD>
	<TD style="padding: 0px;margin: 0px;width: 392px;vertical-align: bottom;" class="tr26"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct took place in the context of a manifest pattern of</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td63"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">similar conduct directed against that group or was conduct that could</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td63"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">itself effect such destruction.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr17 td63"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p256 ft23">Article 6 (b)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Genocide by causing serious bodily or mental harm</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p314 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator caused serious bodily or mental harm to one or more persons. </SPAN><A href="#page_524"><SPAN class="ft137">240</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such person or persons belonged to a particular national, ethnical, racial or religious group.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator intended to destroy, in whole or in part, that national, ethnical, racial or religious group, as such.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct took place in the context of a manifest pattern of similar conduct directed against that group or was conduct that could itself effect such destruction.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 30px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 6 (c)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 187px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Genocide by deliberately inflicting conditions of life calculated to bring about physical destruction</P>
<P class="p608 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p314 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator inflicted certain conditions of life upon one or more persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such person or persons belonged to a particular national, ethnical, racial or religious group.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator intended to destroy, in whole or in part, that national, ethnical, racial or religious group, as such.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conditions of life were calculated to bring about the physical destruction of that group, in whole or in part. </SPAN><A href="#page_524"><SPAN class="ft137">241</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 40px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">240</SPAN><SPAN class="ft45">This conduct may include, but is not necessarily restricted to, acts of torture, rape, sexual violence or inhuman or degrading treatment.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p312 ft74"><SPAN class="ft39">241</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">The term ”conditions of life” may include, but is not necessarily restricted to, deliberate deprivation of resources indispensable for survival, such as food or medical services, or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p317 ft46">systematic expulsion from homes.</P>
<P class="p645 ft2">521</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_525" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 515px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr2 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr2 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">5.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr2 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct took place in the context of a manifest pattern of</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">similar conduct directed against that group or was conduct that could</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">itself effect such destruction.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 6 (d)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Genocide by imposing measures intended to prevent births</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">1. The perpetrator imposed certain measures upon one or more persons.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 31px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">2. Such person or persons belonged to a particular national, ethnical, racial or religious group.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">3. The perpetrator intended to destroy, in whole or in part, that national, ethnical, racial or religious group, as such.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">4. The measures imposed were intended to prevent births within that group.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">5. The conduct took place in the context of a manifest pattern of similar conduct directed against that group or was conduct that could itself effect such destruction.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 30px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 6 (e)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Genocide by forcibly transferring children</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">1. The perpetrator forcibly transferred one or more persons. <A href="#page_525"><SPAN class="ft32">242</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 17px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">2. Such person or persons belonged to a particular national, ethnical, racial or religious group.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">3. The perpetrator intended to destroy, in whole or in part, that national, ethnical, racial or religious group, as such.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">4. The transfer was from that group to another group.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">5. The person or persons were under the age of 18 years.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">6. The perpetrator knew, or should have known, that the person or persons were under the age of 18 years.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 73px;margin-top: 17px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft50">242 </SPAN>The term ”forcibly” is not restricted to physical force, but may include threat of force or coercion, such as that caused by fear of violence, duress, detention, psychological oppression or abuse of power, against such person or persons or another person, or by taking advantage of a coercive environment.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 8px;margin-top: 7px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">522</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_526" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td102"><P class="p13 ft2">7.</P></TD>
	<TD style="padding: 0px;margin: 0px;width: 190px;vertical-align: bottom;" class="tr6"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct took place in the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td262"><P class="p1105 ft2">context of a manifest</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td99"><P class="p934 ft2">pattern of</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 style="padding: 0px;margin: 0px;width: 209px;vertical-align: bottom;" class="tr19"><P class="p13 ft15">similar conduct directed against that</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr19 td262"><P class="p1105 ft15">group or was conduct</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr19 td99"><P class="p934 ft15">that could</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr19 td63"><P class="p13 ft15">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p317 ft2">itself effect such destruction.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 32px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 7</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Crimes against humanity</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Introduction</P>
<P class="p314 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">Since article 7 pertains to international criminal law, its provisions, consistent with article 22, must be strictly construed, taking into account that crimes against humanity as defined in article 7 are among the most serious crimes of concern to the international community as a whole, warrant and entail individual criminal responsibility, and require conduct which is impermissible under generally applicable international law, as recognized by the principal legal systems of the world.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 18px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The last two elements for each crime against humanity describe the context in which the conduct must take place. These elements clarify the requisite participation in and knowledge of a widespread or systematic attack against a civilian population. However, the last element should not be interpreted as requiring proof that the perpetrator had knowledge of all characteristics of the attack or the precise details of the plan or policy of the State or organization. In the case of an emerging widespread or systematic attack against a civilian population, the intent clause of the last element indicates that this mental element is satisfied if the perpetrator intended to further such an attack.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 17px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">”Attack directed against a civilian population” in these context elements is understood to mean a course of conduct involving the multiple commission of acts referred to in article 7, paragraph 1, of the Statute against any civilian population, pursuant to or in furtherance of a State or organizational policy to commit such attack. The acts need not constitute a military attack. It is understood that ”policy to commit such</SPAN></P>
<P class="p581 ft4">attack” requires that the State or organization actively promote or encourage such an attack against a civilian population.<A href="#page_526"><SPAN class="ft90">243</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 166px;margin-top: 138px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft50">243 </SPAN>A policy which has a civilian population as the object of the attack would be implemented by State or organizational action. Such a policy may, in exceptional circumstances, be implemented by a deliberate failure to take action, which is consciously aimed at encouraging such attack. The existence of such a policy cannot be inferred solely from the absence of governmental or organizational action.</P>
<P style="text-align: right;padding-right: 51px;margin-top: 7px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">523</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_527" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 79px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 515px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr24 td182"><P class="p182 ft23">Article 7 (1) (a)</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 rowspan=2 class="tr28 td182"><P class="p182 ft26">Crime against humanity of murder</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr41 td165"><P class="p13 ft108">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr18 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr18 td182"><P class="p182 ft3">Elements</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr21 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr21 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">1.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr21 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator killed <A href="#page_527"><SPAN class="ft32">244</SPAN></A>one or more persons.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr24 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">2.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr24 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">attack directed against a civilian population.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">3.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack against a civilian</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">population.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 7 (1) (b)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Crime against humanity of extermination</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;padding-top: 3px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">1. The perpetrator killed<A href="#page_527"><SPAN class="ft32">245 </SPAN></A>one or more persons, including by inflicting conditions of life calculated to bring about the destruction of part of a population. <A href="#page_527"><SPAN class="ft32">246</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;padding-top: 3px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">2. The conduct constituted, or took place as part of,<A href="#page_527"><SPAN class="ft32">247 </SPAN></A>a mass killing of members of a civilian population.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">3. The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">4. The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 30px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 7 (1) (c)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Crime against humanity of enslavement</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">1. The perpetrator exercised any or all of the powers attaching to the right of ownership over one or more persons, such as by purchasing, selling, lending or bartering such a person or persons, or by imposing on them a similar deprivation of liberty. <A href="#page_527"><SPAN class="ft90">248</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 71px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">244</SPAN><SPAN class="ft45">The term ”killed” is interchangeable with the term ”caused death”. This footnote applies to all elements which use either of these concepts.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 98px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">245</SPAN><SPAN class="ft45">The conduct could be committed by different methods of killing, either directly or indirectly.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">246</SPAN><SPAN class="ft76">The infliction of such conditions could include the deprivation of access to food and</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft88">medicine.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">247</SPAN><SPAN class="ft76">The term ”as part of” would include the initial conduct in a mass killing.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft39">248</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">It is understood that such deprivation of liberty may, in some circumstances, include</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46">exacting forced labour or otherwise reducing a person to a servile status as defined in the</P>
<P class="p522 ft2">524</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_528" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 79px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td102"><P class="p13 ft2">2.</P></TD>
	<TD style="padding: 0px;margin: 0px;width: 392px;vertical-align: bottom;" class="tr6"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">attack directed against a civilian population.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr17 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td102"><P class="p13 ft2">3.</P></TD>
	<TD style="padding: 0px;margin: 0px;width: 392px;vertical-align: bottom;" class="tr26"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td63"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td63"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">civilian population.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr17 td63"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p256 ft23">Article 7 (1) (d)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 206px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft27">Crime against humanity of deportation or forcible transfer of population</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 2px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;padding-top: 3px;margin-top: 2px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator deported or forcibly</SPAN><A href="#page_528"><SPAN class="ft32">249 </SPAN></A>transferred,<A href="#page_528"><SPAN class="ft32">250 </SPAN></A>without grounds permitted under international law, one or more persons to another State or location, by expulsion or other coercive acts.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such person or persons were lawfully present in the area from which they were so deported or transferred.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established the lawfulness of such presence.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 30px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 7 (1) (e)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 231px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Crime against humanity of imprisonment or other severe deprivation of physical liberty</P>
<P class="p608 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p314 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator imprisoned one or more persons or otherwise severely deprived one or more persons of physical liberty.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The gravity of the conduct was such that it was in violation of fundamental rules of international law.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 162px;margin-top: 36px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft74">Supplementary Convention on the Abolition of Slavery, the Slave Trade, and Institutions and Practices Similar to Slavery of 1956. It is also understood that the conduct described in this element includes trafficking in persons, in particular women and children.</P>
<P class="p50 ft44"><SPAN class="ft39">249</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The term ”forcibly” is not restricted to physical force, but may include threat of force or coercion, such as that caused by fear of violence, duress, detention, psychological oppression or abuse of power against such person or persons or another person, or by taking advantage of a coercive environment.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p644 ft41"><SPAN class="ft39">250</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">”Deported or forcibly transferred” is interchangeable with ”forcibly displaced”.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p645 ft2">525</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_529" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 51px 0px 79px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 515px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 122px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 1px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 393px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft22">3. The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established the gravity of the conduct.</P>
<P class="p267 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p267 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 29px 0px 0px 8px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 575px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p137 ft23">Article 7 (1) (f)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Crime against humanity of torture <A href="#page_529"><SPAN style="font: bold 9px 'Times New Roman';line-height: 12px;position: relative; bottom: 6px;">251</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator inflicted severe physical or mental pain or suffering upon one or more persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such person or persons were in the custody or under the control of the perpetrator.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such pain or suffering did not arise only from, and was not inherent in or incidental to, lawful sanctions.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 30px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 7 (1) <NOBR>(g)-1</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Crime against humanity of rape</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;padding-top: 3px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator invaded</SPAN><A href="#page_529"><SPAN class="ft32">252 </SPAN></A>the body of a person by conduct resulting in penetration, however slight, of any part of the body of the victim or of the perpetrator with a sexual organ, or of the anal or genital opening of the victim with any object or any other part of the body.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The invasion was committed by force, or by threat of force or coercion, such as that caused by fear of violence, duress, detention, psychological oppression or abuse of power, against such person or another person, or by taking advantage of a coercive environment, or the</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 31px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft41"><SPAN class="ft39">251</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">It is understood that no specific purpose need be proved for this crime.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">252</SPAN><SPAN class="ft76">The concept of ”invasion” is intended to be broad enough to be </SPAN><NOBR>gender-neutral.</NOBR></P>
<P class="p16 ft2">526</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_530" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">invasion was committed against a person incapable of giving genuine</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">consent. <SPAN class="ft32">253</SPAN></P></TD>
	<TD class="tr24 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p273 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p256 ft23">Article 7 (1) <NOBR>(g)-2</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Crime against humanity of sexual slavery<A href="#page_530"><SPAN style="font: bold 9px 'Times New Roman';line-height: 12px;position: relative; bottom: 6px;">254</SPAN></A></P>
<P class="p641 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p47 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator exercised any or all of the powers attaching to the right of ownership over one or more persons, such as by purchasing,</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">selling, lending or bartering such a person or persons, or by imposing on them a similar deprivation of liberty.<A href="#page_530"><SPAN class="ft137">255</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator caused such person or persons to engage in one or more acts of a sexual nature.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p256 ft23">Article 7 (1) <NOBR>(g)-3</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Crime against humanity of enforced prostitution</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p314 ft4">1. The perpetrator caused one or more persons to engage in one or more acts of a sexual nature by force, or by threat of force or coercion, such as that caused by fear of violence, duress, detention, psychological oppression or abuse of power, against such person or persons or another</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 170px;margin-top: 22px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft39">253</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">It is understood that a person may be incapable of giving genuine consent if affected by natural, induced or </SPAN><NOBR>age-related</NOBR> incapacity. This footnote also applies to the corresponding elements of article 7 (1) <NOBR>(g)-3,</NOBR> 5 and 6.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 189px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft74"><SPAN class="ft39">254</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">Given the complex nature of this crime, it is recognized that its commission could involve more than one perpetrator as a part of a common criminal purpose.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p644 ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">255</SPAN><SPAN class="ft45">It is understood that such deprivation of liberty may, in some circumstances, include</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 162px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft42">exacting forced labour or otherwise reducing a person to a servile status as defined in the Supplementary Convention on the Abolition of Slavery, the Slave Trade, and Institutions and Practices Similar to Slavery of 1956. It is also understood that the conduct described in this element includes trafficking in persons, in particular women and children.</P>
<P class="p645 ft2">527</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_531" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 51px 0px 79px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 515px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 122px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 1px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 393px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft22">person, or by taking advantage of a coercive environment or such person’s or persons’ incapacity to give genuine consent.</P>
<P class="p267 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator or another person obtained or expected to obtain pecuniary or other advantage in exchange for or in connection with the acts of a sexual nature.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p824 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p267 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 30px 0px 0px 8px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 575px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p137 ft23">Article 7 (1) <NOBR>(g)-4</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Crime against humanity of forced pregnancy</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator confined one or more women forcibly made pregnant, with the intent of affecting the ethnic composition of any population or carrying out other grave violations of international law.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 29px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 7 (1) <NOBR>(g)-5</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Crime against humanity of enforced sterilization</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator deprived one or more persons of biological reproductive capacity.</SPAN><A href="#page_531"><SPAN class="ft137">256</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The conduct was neither justified by the medical or hospital</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 2px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">treatment of the person or persons concerned nor carried out with their genuine consent.<A href="#page_531"><SPAN class="ft137">257</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 90px;margin-top: 20px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">256</SPAN><SPAN class="ft45">The deprivation is not intended to include </SPAN><NOBR>birth-control</NOBR> measures which have a non- permanent effect in practice.</P>
<P class="p107 ft41"><SPAN class="ft39">257</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">It is understood that ”genuine consent” does not include consent obtained through</SPAN></P>
<P class="p137 ft46">deception.</P>
<P class="p16 ft2">528</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_532" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td102"><P class="p13 ft2">4.</P></TD>
	<TD style="padding: 0px;margin: 0px;width: 392px;vertical-align: bottom;" class="tr6"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr19 td263"><P class="p13 ft15">conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr19 td63"><P class="p13 ft15">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p317 ft2">civilian population.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 32px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 7 (1) <NOBR>(g)-6</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Crime against humanity of sexual violence</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p314 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator committed an act of a sexual nature against one or more persons or caused such person or persons to engage in an act of a sexual nature by force, or by threat of force or coercion, such as that caused by fear of violence, duress, detention, psychological oppression or abuse of power, against such person or persons or another person, or by taking advantage of a coercive environment or such person’s or persons’ incapacity to give genuine consent.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 18px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such conduct was of a gravity comparable to the other offences in article 7, paragraph 1 (g), of the Statute.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established the gravity of the conduct.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p256 ft23">Article 7 (1) (h)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Crime against humanity of persecution</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;padding-top: 3px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator severely deprived, contrary to international law,</SPAN><A href="#page_532"><SPAN class="ft32">258 </SPAN></A>one or more persons of fundamental rights.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator targeted such person or persons by reason of the identity of a group or collectivity or targeted the group or collectivity as such.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Such targeting was based on political, racial, national, ethnic, cultural, religious, gender as defined in article 7, paragraph 3, of the Statute, or other grounds that are universally recognized as impermissible under international law.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 172px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft50">258 </SPAN>This requirement is without prejudice to paragraph 6 of the General Introduction to the Elements of Crimes.</P>
<P class="p318 ft2">529</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_533" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 51px 0px 80px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 583px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 122px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 1px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 461px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p77 ft4">4. The conduct was committed in connection with any act referred to in article 7, paragraph 1, of the Statute or any crime within the jurisdiction of the Court.<A href="#page_533"><SPAN class="ft90">259</SPAN></A></P>
<P class="p815 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p816 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;margin-top: 30px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 7 (1) (i)</P>
<P class="p590 ft26">Crime against humanity of enforced disappearance of persons<A href="#page_533"><SPAN style="font: bold 9px 'Times New Roman';line-height: 12px;position: relative; bottom: 6px;">260261</SPAN></A></P>
<P class="p734 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p338 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p904 ft2"><SPAN style="font: 12px 'Arial';line-height: 15px;">−</SPAN><SPAN class="ft200">(a) Arrested, detained </SPAN><A href="#page_533"><SPAN class="ft32">262263</SPAN></A>or abducted one or more persons; or</P>
<P class="p353 ft149"><SPAN style="font: 12px 'Arial';line-height: 15px;">−</SPAN><SPAN class="ft166">(b) Refused to acknowledge the arrest, detention or abduction, or to give information on the fate or whereabouts of such person or persons.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p652 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">(a) Such arrest, detention or abduction was followed or accompanied by a refusal to acknowledge that deprivation of freedom or to give information on the fate or whereabouts of such person or persons; or</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;text-indent: 28px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft155">Such refusal was preceded or accompanied by that deprivation of freedom.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p887 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator was aware that:</SPAN><A href="#page_533"><SPAN class="ft32">264</SPAN></A></P>
<P class="p353 ft22"><SPAN style="font: 12px 'Arial';line-height: 15px;">−</SPAN><SPAN class="ft226">(a) Such arrest, detention or abduction would be followed in the ordinary course of events by a refusal to acknowledge that deprivation of</SPAN></P>
<P class="p77 ft22">freedom or to give information on the fate or whereabouts of such person or persons;<A href="#page_533"><SPAN class="ft137">265 </SPAN></A>or</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft149"><SPAN style="font: 12px 'Arial';line-height: 15px;">−</SPAN><SPAN class="ft166">(b) Such refusal was preceded or accompanied by that deprivation of freedom.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 27px 0px 0px 8px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 575px;overflow: hidden;">
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 89px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">259</SPAN><SPAN class="ft45">It is understood that no additional mental element is necessary for this element other than that inherent in element 6.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 96px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft74"><SPAN class="ft39">260</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">Given the complex nature of this crime, it is recognized that its commission will normally involve more than one perpetrator as a part of a common criminal purpose.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 96px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft39">261</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">This crime falls under the jurisdiction of the Court only if the attack referred to in elements 7 and 8 occurs after the entry into force of the Statute.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft41"><SPAN class="ft39">262</SPAN><SPAN class="ft95">The word ”detained” would include a perpetrator who maintained an existing detention.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 82px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft39">263</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">It is understood that under certain circumstances an arrest or detention may have been lawful.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">264</SPAN><SPAN class="ft76">This element, inserted because of the complexity of this crime, is without prejudice to</SPAN></P>
<P class="p137 ft88">the General Introduction to the Elements of Crimes.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 75px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft50">265 </SPAN>It is understood that, in the case of a perpetrator who maintained an existing detention, this element would be satisfied if the perpetrator was aware that such a refusal had already taken place.</P>
<P class="p381 ft2">530</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_534" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 79px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td102"><P class="p13 ft2">4.</P></TD>
	<TD style="padding: 0px;margin: 0px;width: 392px;vertical-align: bottom;" class="tr6"><P class="p135 ft2">Such arrest, detention or abduction was carried out by, or with the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr19 td263"><P class="p13 ft15">authorization, support or acquiescence of, a State or a political</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr19 td63"><P class="p13 ft15">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p317 ft2">organization.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Such refusal to acknowledge that deprivation of freedom or to give information on the fate or whereabouts of such person or persons was carried out by, or with the authorization or support of, such State or political organization.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator intended to remove such person or persons from the protection of the law for a prolonged period of time.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">8.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 30px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 7 (1) (j)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">Crime against humanity of apartheid</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p314 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator committed an inhumane act against one or more persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such act was an act referred to in article 7, paragraph 1, of the Statute, or was an act of a character similar to any of those acts.</SPAN><A href="#page_534"><SPAN class="ft137">266</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established the character of the act.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p403 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct was committed in the context of an institutionalized regime of systematic oppression and domination by one racial group over any other racial group or groups.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p644 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator intended to maintain such regime by that conduct.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">7.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a civilian population.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 69px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft41"><SPAN class="ft50">266 </SPAN>It is understood that ”character” refers to the nature and gravity of the act.</P>
<P class="p645 ft2">531</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_535" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 79px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 515px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr24 td182"><P class="p182 ft23">Article 7 (1) (k)</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 rowspan=2 class="tr28 td182"><P class="p182 ft26">Crime against humanity of other inhumane acts</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr41 td165"><P class="p13 ft108">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr18 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr18 td182"><P class="p182 ft3">Elements</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr16 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr16 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">1.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr16 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator inflicted great suffering, or serious injury to body or</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">to mental or physical health, by means of an inhumane act.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr28 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">2.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">Such act was of a character similar to any other act referred to in</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">article 7, paragraph 1, of the Statute. <SPAN class="ft32">267</SPAN></P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">3.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr5 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">established the character of the act.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr28 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">4.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct was committed as part of a widespread or systematic</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">attack directed against a civilian population.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">5.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator knew that the conduct was part of or intended the</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">conduct to be part of a widespread or systematic attack directed against a</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr5 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">civilian population.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crimes</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Introduction</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 3px;margin-bottom: 0px;text-indent: 28px;" class="ft4">The elements for war crimes under article 8, paragraph 2 (c) and (e), are subject to the limitations addressed in article 8, paragraph 2 (d) and (f), which are not elements of crimes.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;text-indent: 28px;" class="ft2">The elements for war crimes under article 8, paragraph 2, of the Statute shall be interpreted within the established framework of the international law of armed conflict including, as appropriate, the international law of armed conflict applicable to armed conflict at sea.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 150px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">With respect to the last two elements listed for each crime:</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;text-indent: 28px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">•</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 3px;line-height: 16px;">There is no requirement for a legal evaluation by the perpetrator as to the existence of an armed conflict or its character as international or </SPAN><NOBR>non-international;</NOBR></P>
