<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;text-indent: 28px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">•</SPAN><SPAN class="ft159">In that context there is no requirement for awareness by the perpetrator of the facts that established the character of the conflict as international or </SPAN><NOBR>non-international;</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;text-indent: 28px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">•</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 7px;line-height: 16px;">There is only a requirement for the awareness of the factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict that is implicit in the terms ”took place in the context of and was associated with”.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 91px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft41"><SPAN class="ft50">267 </SPAN>It is understood that ”character” refers to the nature and gravity of the act.</P>
<P class="p522 ft2">532</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_536" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 49px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 68px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 556px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 3px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 411px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft23">Article 8 (2) (a)</P>
<P class="p91 ft23">Article 8 (2) (a) (i)</P>
<P class="p91 ft26">War crime of wilful killing</P>
<P class="p89 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p646 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator killed one or more persons.</SPAN><A href="#page_536"><SPAN class="ft32">268</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 17px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such person or persons were protected under one or more of the Geneva Conventions of 1949.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established that protected status.</SPAN><A href="#page_536"><SPAN class="ft137">269270</SPAN></A></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict. </SPAN><A href="#page_536"><SPAN class="ft137">271</SPAN></A></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p325 ft23">Article 8 (2) (a) <NOBR>(ii)-1</NOBR></P>
<P class="p91 ft26">War crime of torture</P>
<P class="p936 ft3">Elements<A href="#page_536"><SPAN style="font: italic 9px 'Times New Roman';line-height: 10px;position: relative; bottom: 6px;">272</SPAN></A></P>
<P class="p906 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator inflicted severe physical or mental pain or suffering upon one or more persons.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator inflicted the pain or suffering for such purposes as: obtaining information or a confession, punishment, intimidation or coercion or for any reason based on discrimination of any kind.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p950 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Such person or persons were protected under one or more of the Geneva Conventions of 1949.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 145px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 41px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 624px;overflow: hidden;">
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 166px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">268</SPAN><SPAN class="ft45">The term ”killed” is interchangeable with the term ”caused death”. This footnote applies to all elements which use either of these concepts.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 167px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft74"><SPAN class="ft39">269</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">This mental element recognizes the interplay between articles 30 and 32. This footnote also applies to the corresponding element in each crime under article 8 (2) (a), and to the element in other crimes in article 8 (2) concerning the awareness of factual circumstances</SPAN></P>
<P class="p50 ft44">that establish the status of persons or property protected under the relevant international law of armed conflict.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 170px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft39">270</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">With respect to nationality, it is understood that the perpetrator needs only to know that the victim belonged to an adverse party to the conflict. This footnote also applies to the corresponding element in each crime under article 8 (2) (a).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p644 ft41"><SPAN class="ft39">271</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The term ”international armed conflict” includes military occupation. This footnote also</SPAN></P>
<P class="p317 ft88">applies to the corresponding element in each crime under article 8 (2) (a).</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 168px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft50">272 </SPAN>As element 3 requires that all victims must be ”protected persons” under one or more of the Geneva Conventions of 1949, these elements do not include the custody or control requirement found in the elements of article 7 (1) (e).</P>
<P class="p318 ft2">533</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_537" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 51px 0px 80px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 515px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 122px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 1px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 393px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft22">4. The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established that protected status.</P>
<P class="p267 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p267 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 28px 0px 0px 8px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 575px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p137 ft23">Article 8 (2) (a) <NOBR>(ii)-2</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of inhuman treatment</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator inflicted severe physical or mental pain or suffering upon one or more persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such person or persons were protected under one or more of the Geneva Conventions of 1949.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established that protected status.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p958 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 29px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (a) <NOBR>(ii)-3</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of biological experiments</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator subjected one or more persons to a particular biological experiment.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The experiment seriously endangered the physical or mental health or integrity of such person or persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The intent of the experiment was </SPAN><NOBR>non-therapeutic</NOBR> and it was neither justified by medical reasons nor carried out in such person’s or persons’ interest.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Such person or persons were protected under one or more of the Geneva Conventions of 1949.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established that protected status.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p358 ft2">534</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_538" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td102"><P class="p13 ft2">6.</P></TD>
	<TD style="padding: 0px;margin: 0px;width: 392px;vertical-align: bottom;" class="tr6"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">international armed conflict.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr17 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td102"><P class="p13 ft2">7.</P></TD>
	<TD style="padding: 0px;margin: 0px;width: 392px;vertical-align: bottom;" class="tr26"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td63"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr5 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">the existence of an armed conflict.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td63"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (a) (iii)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of wilfully causing great suffering</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p273 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator caused great physical or mental pain or suffering to, or serious injury to body or health of, one or more persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Such person or persons were protected under one or more of the Geneva Conventions of 1949.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established that protected status.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (a) (iv)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of destruction and appropriation of property</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator destroyed or appropriated certain property.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The destruction or appropriation was not justified by military necessity.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The destruction or appropriation was extensive and carried out wantonly.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such property was protected under one or more of the Geneva Conventions of 1949.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established that protected status.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: right;padding-right: 51px;margin-top: 26px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">535</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_539" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 515px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr2 td261"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr2 td5"><P class="p13 ft2">7. The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td261"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr17 td5"><P class="p13 ft2">the existence of an armed conflict.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (a) (v)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of compelling service in hostile forces</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator coerced one or more persons, by act or threat, to take part in military operations against that person’s own country or forces or otherwise serve in the forces of a hostile power.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such person or persons were protected under one or more of the Geneva Conventions of 1949.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established that protected status.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 27px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (a) (vi)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of denying a fair trial</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator deprived one or more persons of a fair and regular trial by denying judicial guarantees as defined, in particular, in the third and the fourth Geneva Conventions of 1949.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such person or persons were protected under one or more of the Geneva Conventions of 1949.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established that protected status.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 8px;margin-top: 73px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">536</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_540" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 49px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 68px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 556px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 3px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 411px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft23">Article 8 (2) (a) <NOBR>(vii)-1</NOBR></P>
<P class="p358 ft26">War crime of unlawful deportation and transfer</P>
<P class="p106 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p907 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator deported or transferred one or more persons to another State or to another location.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such person or persons were protected under one or more of the Geneva Conventions of 1949.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established that protected status.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p848 ft23">Article 8 (2) (a) <NOBR>(vii)-2</NOBR></P>
<P class="p91 ft26">War crime of unlawful confinement</P>
<P class="p106 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p907 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator confined or continued to confine one or more persons to a certain location.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Such person or persons were protected under one or more of the Geneva Conventions of 1949.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established that protected status.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p950 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p950 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 145px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 30px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 624px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p317 ft23">Article 8 (2) (a) (viii)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of taking hostages</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p273 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator seized, detained or otherwise held hostage one or more persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator threatened to kill, injure or continue to detain such person or persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: right;padding-right: 51px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">537</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_541" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 51px 0px 80px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 122px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 8px;margin-top: 737px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">538</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 1px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 461px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p77 ft4">3. The perpetrator intended to compel a State, an international organization, a natural or legal person or a group of persons to act or refrain from acting as an explicit or implicit condition for the safety or the release of such person or persons.</P>
<P class="p815 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Such person or persons were protected under one or more of the Geneva Conventions of 1949.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p825 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established that protected status.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p816 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p848 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b)</P>
<P class="p90 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (i)</P>
<P class="p91 ft26">War crime of attacking civilians</P>
<P class="p89 ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator directed an attack.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The object of the attack was a civilian population as such or individual civilians not taking direct part in hostilities.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p816 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator intended the civilian population as such or individual civilians not taking direct part in hostilities to be the object of the attack.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p831 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p831 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;margin-top: 30px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (ii)</P>
<P class="p91 ft26">War crime of attacking civilian objects</P>
<P class="p89 ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator directed an attack.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The object of the attack was civilian objects, that is, objects which are not military objectives.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_542" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td102"><P class="p13 ft2">3.</P></TD>
	<TD style="padding: 0px;margin: 0px;width: 392px;vertical-align: bottom;" class="tr6"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator intended such civilian objects to be the object of the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">attack.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr17 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (iii)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 229px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft27">War crime of attacking personnel or objects involved in a humanitarian assistance or peacekeeping mission</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator directed an attack.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The object of the attack was personnel, installations, material, units or vehicles involved in a humanitarian assistance or peacekeeping mission in accordance with the Charter of the United Nations.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator intended such personnel, installations, material, units or vehicles so involved to be the object of the attack.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Such personnel, installations, material, units or vehicles were entitled to that protection given to civilians or civilian objects under the international law of armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established that protection.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p401 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (iv)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of excessive incidental death, injury, or damage</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator launched an attack.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The attack was such that it would cause incidental death or injury to civilians or damage to civilian objects or widespread, </SPAN><NOBR>long-term</NOBR> and severe damage to the natural environment and that such death, injury or</P>
<P style="text-align: right;padding-right: 51px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">539</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_543" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 51px 0px 79px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 515px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 122px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 1px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 393px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft22">damage would be of such an extent as to be clearly excessive in relation to the concrete and direct overall military advantage anticipated.<A href="#page_543"><SPAN class="ft137">273</SPAN></A></P>
<P class="p857 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator knew that the attack would cause incidental death or injury to civilians or damage to civilian objects or widespread, long- term and severe damage to the natural environment and that such death, injury or damage would be of such an extent as to be clearly excessive in</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-top: 3px;margin-top: 3px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">relation to the concrete and direct overall military advantage anticipated.<A href="#page_543"><SPAN class="ft32">274</SPAN></A></P>
<P class="p824 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p267 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 28px 0px 0px 8px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 575px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p137 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (v)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of attacking undefended places<A href="#page_543"><SPAN style="font: bold 9px 'Times New Roman';line-height: 12px;position: relative; bottom: 6px;">275</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator attacked one or more towns, villages, dwellings or buildings.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such towns, villages, dwellings or buildings were open for unresisted occupation.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Such towns, villages, dwellings or buildings did not constitute military objectives.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 70px;margin-top: 43px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft50">273 </SPAN>The expression ”concrete and direct overall military advantage” refers to a military advantage that is foreseeable by the perpetrator at the relevant time. Such advantage may or may not be temporally or geographically related to the object of the attack. The fact that this crime admits the possibility of lawful incidental injury and collateral damage does not in any way justify any violation of the law applicable in armed conflict. It does not address justifications for war or other rules related to <SPAN class="ft134">jus ad bellum</SPAN>. It reflects the proportionality requirement inherent in determining the legality of any military activity undertaken in the context of an armed conflict.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 76px;margin-top: 2px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft50">274 </SPAN>As opposed to the general rule set forth in paragraph 4 of the General Introduction, this knowledge element requires that the perpetrator make the value judgement as described therein. An evaluation of that value judgement must be based on the requisite information available to the perpetrator at the time.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 79px;margin-top: 3px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft74"><SPAN class="ft94">275 </SPAN>The presence in the locality of persons specially protected under the Geneva Conventions of 1949 or of police forces retained for the sole purpose of maintaining law and order does not by itself render the locality a military objective.</P>
<P class="p16 ft2">540</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_544" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 49px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 68px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 556px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 3px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 411px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (vi)</P>
<P class="p358 ft26">War crime of killing or wounding a person <SPAN class="ft238">hors de combat</SPAN></P>
<P class="p89 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p858 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator killed or injured one or more persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">Such person or persons were </SPAN><SPAN class="ft3">hors de combat</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p955 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established this status.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p325 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(vii)-1</NOBR></P>
<P class="p91 ft26">War crime of improper use of a flag of truce</P>
<P class="p89 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p858 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator used a flag of truce.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p873 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator made such use in order to feign an intention to negotiate when there was no such intention on the part of the perpetrator.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator knew or should have known of the prohibited nature of such use.</SPAN><A href="#page_544"><SPAN class="ft90">276</SPAN></A></P>
<P class="p118 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The conduct resulted in death or serious personal injury.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p955 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator knew that the conduct could result in death or serious personal injury.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 145px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 123px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 573px;overflow: hidden;">
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 115px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft50">276 </SPAN>This mental element recognizes the interplay between article 30 and article 32. The term ”prohibited nature” denotes illegality.</P>
<P style="text-align: right;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">541</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_545" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 79px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 515px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr24 td182"><P class="p182 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(vii)-2</NOBR></P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 rowspan=2 class="tr24 td182"><P class="p182 ft26">War crime of improper use of a flag, insignia or uniform of the</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr29 td165"><P class="p13 ft61">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr5 td182"><P class="p182 ft26">hostile party</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr18 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr18 td182"><P class="p182 ft3">Elements</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr16 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr16 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">1.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr16 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator used a flag, insignia or uniform of the hostile party.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr25 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr25 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">2.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr25 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator made such use in a manner prohibited under the</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr5 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">international law of armed conflict while engaged in an attack.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr23 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr23 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">3.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr23 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator knew or should have known of the prohibited</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">nature of such use.<SPAN class="ft32">277</SPAN></P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">4.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct resulted in death or serious personal injury.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr28 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">5.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator knew that the conduct could result in death or</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr5 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">serious personal injury.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr28 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">6.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr5 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">international armed conflict.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr28 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">7.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr5 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">the existence of an armed conflict.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(vii)-3</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 104px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft27">War crime of improper use of a flag, insignia or uniform of the United Nations</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 2px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">1. The perpetrator used a flag, insignia or uniform of the United Nations.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 31px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">2. The perpetrator made such use in a manner prohibited under the international law of armed conflict.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">3. The perpetrator knew of the prohibited nature of such use.<A href="#page_545"><SPAN class="ft32">278</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 17px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">4. The conduct resulted in death or serious personal injury.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">5. The perpetrator knew that the conduct could result in death or serious personal injury.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">6. The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 71px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">277</SPAN><SPAN class="ft45">This mental element recognizes the interplay between article 30 and article 32. The term ”prohibited nature” denotes illegality.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 65px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft74"><SPAN class="ft39">278</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">This mental element recognizes the interplay between article 30 and article 32. The ”should have known” test required in the other offences found in article 8 (2) (b) (vii) is not</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46">applicable here because of the variable and regulatory nature of the relevant prohibitions.</P>
<P class="p522 ft2">542</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_546" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 79px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">7. The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">the existence of an armed conflict.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr17 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p256 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(vii)-4</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 168px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft27">War crime of improper use of the distinctive emblems of the Geneva Conventions</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p273 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator used the distinctive emblems of the Geneva Conventions.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;padding-top: 3px;margin-top: 8px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator made such use for combatant purposes</SPAN><A href="#page_546"><SPAN class="ft32">279 </SPAN></A>in a manner prohibited under the international law of armed conflict.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator knew or should have known of the prohibited nature of such use.</SPAN><A href="#page_546"><SPAN class="ft137">280</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The conduct resulted in death or serious personal injury.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator knew that the conduct could result in death or serious personal injury.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (viii)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 166px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">The transfer, directly or indirectly, by the Occupying Power of parts of its own civilian population into the territory it occupies, or the deportation or transfer of all or parts of the population of the occupied territory within or outside this territory</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 2px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 7px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft161">The perpetrator:</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;padding-top: 3px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;text-indent: 29px;" class="ft2">(a)Transferred<A href="#page_546"><SPAN class="ft32">281 </SPAN></A>directly or indirectly, parts of its own population into the territory it occupies; or</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;text-indent: 28px;" class="ft22">(b)Deported or transferred all or parts of the population of the occupied territory within or outside this territory.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 204px;margin-top: 30px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">279</SPAN><SPAN class="ft45">Combatant purposes” in these circumstances means purposes directly related to hostilities and not including medical, religious or similar activities.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 166px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">280</SPAN><SPAN class="ft45">This mental element recognizes the interplay between article 30 and article 32. The term ”prohibited nature” denotes illegality.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p644 ft44"><SPAN class="ft39">281</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The term ”transfer” needs to be interpreted in accordance with the relevant provisions of</SPAN></P>
<P class="p317 ft46">international humanitarian law.</P>
<P class="p645 ft2">543</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_547" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 51px 0px 79px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 515px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 122px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 1px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 393px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p134 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p267 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 28px 0px 0px 8px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 575px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p137 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (ix)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of attacking protected objects<A href="#page_547"><SPAN style="font: bold 9px 'Times New Roman';line-height: 12px;position: relative; bottom: 6px;">282</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator directed an attack.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The object of the attack was one or more buildings dedicated to religion, education, art, science or charitable purposes, historic monuments, hospitals or places where the sick and wounded are collected, which were not military objectives.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator intended such building or buildings dedicated to religion, education, art, science or charitable purposes, historic monuments, hospitals or places where the sick and wounded are collected, which were not military objectives, to be the object of the attack.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(x)-1</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of mutilation</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator subjected one or more persons to mutilation, in particular by permanently disfiguring the person or persons, or by permanently disabling or removing an organ or appendage.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct caused death or seriously endangered the physical or mental health of such person or persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The conduct was neither justified by the medical, dental or hospital</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 3px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">treatment of the person or persons concerned nor carried out in such person’s or persons’ interest.<A href="#page_547"><SPAN class="ft90">283</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 79px;margin-top: 20px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft74"><SPAN class="ft94">282 </SPAN>The presence in the locality of persons specially protected under the Geneva Conventions of 1949 or of police forces retained for the sole purpose of maintaining law and order does not by itself render the locality a military objective.</P>
<P class="p16 ft2">544</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_548" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">4. Such person or persons were in the power of an adverse party.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr19 td263"><P class="p13 ft47">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr19 td63"><P class="p13 ft15">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p312 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 30px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(x)-2</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of medical or scientific experiments</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p273 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator subjected one or more persons to a medical or scientific experiment.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The experiment caused death or seriously endangered the physical or mental health or integrity of such person or persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct was neither justified by the medical, dental or hospital treatment of such person or persons concerned nor carried out in such person’s or persons’ interest.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">Such person or persons were in the power of an adverse party.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 30px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xi)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of treacherously killing or wounding</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p314 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator invited the confidence or belief of one or more persons that they were entitled to, or were obliged to accord, protection under rules of international law applicable in armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator intended to betray that confidence or belief.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator killed or injured such person or persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 165px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft50">283 </SPAN>Consent is not a defence to this crime. The crime prohibits any medical procedure which is not indicated by the state of health of the person concerned and which is not consistent with generally accepted medical standards which would be applied under similar medical circumstances to persons who are nationals of the party conducting the procedure and who are in no way deprived of liberty. This footnote also applies to the same element for article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(x)-2.</NOBR></P>
<P class="p603 ft2">545</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_549" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 79px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 515px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr2 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr2 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">4.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr2 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator made use of that confidence or belief in killing or</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">injuring such person or persons.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">5.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">Such person or persons belonged to an adverse party.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr25 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr25 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">6.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr25 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">international armed conflict.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">7.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">the existence of an armed conflict.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 29px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xii)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of denying quarter</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">1. The perpetrator declared or ordered that there shall be no survivors.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">2. Such declaration or order was given in order to threaten an adversary or to conduct hostilities on the basis that there shall be no survivors.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 26px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">3. The perpetrator was in a position of effective command or control over the subordinate forces to which the declaration or order was directed.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 17px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">4. The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">5. The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 29px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xiii)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of destroying or seizing the enemy’s property</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator destroyed or seized certain property.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">Such property was property of a hostile party.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Such property was protected from that destruction or seizure under the international law of armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established the status of the property.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The destruction or seizure was not justified by military necessity.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p522 ft2">546</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_550" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">7. The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">the existence of an armed conflict.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr17 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p256 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xiv)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft27">War crime of depriving the nationals of the hostile power of rights or actions</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p273 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator effected the abolition, suspension or termination of admissibility in a court of law of certain rights or actions.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The abolition, suspension or termination was directed at the nationals of a hostile party.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator intended the abolition, suspension or termination to be directed at the nationals of a hostile party.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xv)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of compelling participation in military operations</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p273 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator coerced one or more persons by act or threat to take part in military operations against that person’s own country or forces.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">Such person or persons were nationals of a hostile party.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft190">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p256 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xvi)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of pillaging</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator appropriated certain property.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: right;padding-right: 51px;margin-top: 37px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">547</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_551" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 79px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 515px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">2.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td197"><P class="p135 ft35">The perpetrator intended to deprive the owner of the property and to</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr24 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">appropriate it for private or personal use.<SPAN class="ft32">284</SPAN></P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr1 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr1 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">3.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr1 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The appropriation was without the consent of the owner.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr25 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr25 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">4.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr25 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">international armed conflict.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">5.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">the existence of an armed conflict.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 29px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xvii)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of employing poison or poisoned weapons</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">1. The perpetrator employed a substance or a weapon that releases a substance as a result of its employment.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">2. The substance was such that it causes death or serious damage to health in the ordinary course of events, through its toxic properties.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">3. The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">4. The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 29px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xviii)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 105px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of employing prohibited gases, liquids, materials or devices</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 3px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 3px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">1. The perpetrator employed a gas or other analogous substance or device.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">2. The gas, substance or device was such that it causes death or serious damage to health in the ordinary course of events, through its asphyxiating or toxic properties.<A href="#page_551"><SPAN class="ft90">285</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">3. The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 73px;margin-top: 40px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">284</SPAN><SPAN class="ft45">As indicated by the use of the term ”private or personal use”, appropriations justified by military necessity cannot constitute the crime of pillaging.</SPAN></P>
