<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 74px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft74"><SPAN class="ft39">285</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">Nothing in this element shall be interpreted as limiting or prejudicing in any way existing or developing rules of international law with respect to development, production,</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46">stockpiling and use of chemical weapons.</P>
<P class="p522 ft2">548</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_552" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">4. The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">the existence of an armed conflict.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr17 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p256 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xix)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of employing prohibited bullets</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator employed certain bullets.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The bullets were such that their use violates the international law of armed conflict because they expand or flatten easily in the human body.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator was aware that the nature of the bullets was such that their employment would uselessly aggravate suffering or the wounding effect.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xx)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 211px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft27">War crime of employing weapons, projectiles or materials or methods of warfare listed in the Annex to the Statute</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">[Elements will have to be drafted once weapons, projectiles or material or methods of warfare have been included in an annex to the Statute.]</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 30px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xxi)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of outrages upon personal dignity</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p273 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator humiliated, degraded or otherwise violated the dignity of one or more persons. </SPAN><A href="#page_552"><SPAN class="ft90">286</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The severity of the humiliation, degradation or other violation was of such degree as to be generally recognized as an outrage upon personal dignity.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 164px;margin-top: 25px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft50">286 </SPAN>For this crime, ”persons” can include dead persons. It is understood that the victim need not personally be aware of the existence of the humiliation or degradation or other violation. This element takes into account relevant aspects of the cultural background of the victim.</P>
<P style="text-align: right;padding-right: 51px;margin-top: 7px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">549</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_553" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 51px 0px 80px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 515px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 122px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 1px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 393px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p134 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p267 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 44px 0px 0px 8px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 575px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p137 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(xxii)-1</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of rape</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;padding-top: 3px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator invaded</SPAN><A href="#page_553"><SPAN class="ft32">287 </SPAN></A>the body of a person by conduct resulting in penetration, however slight, of any part of the body of the victim or of the perpetrator with a sexual organ, or of the anal or genital opening of the victim with any object or any other part of the body.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The invasion was committed by force, or by threat of force or coercion, such as that caused by fear of violence, duress, detention, psychological oppression or abuse of power, against such person or another person, or by taking advantage of a coercive environment, or the</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;padding-top: 3px;margin-top: 3px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">invasion was committed against a person incapable of giving genuine consent.<A href="#page_553"><SPAN class="ft32">288</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(xxii)-2</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of sexual slavery<A href="#page_553"><SPAN style="font: bold 9px 'Times New Roman';line-height: 12px;position: relative; bottom: 6px;">289</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">1. The perpetrator exercised any or all of the powers attaching to the right of ownership over one or more persons, such as by purchasing, selling, lending or bartering such a person or persons, or by imposing on them a similar deprivation of liberty.<A href="#page_553"><SPAN class="ft90">290</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft41"><SPAN class="ft39">287</SPAN><SPAN class="ft95">The concept of ”invasion” is intended to be broad enough to be </SPAN><NOBR>gender-neutral.</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 75px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft39">288</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">It is understood that a person may be incapable of giving genuine consent if affected by natural, induced or </SPAN><NOBR>age-related</NOBR> incapacity. This footnote also applies to the corresponding elements of article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(xxii)-3,</NOBR> 5 and 6.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 94px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft42"><SPAN class="ft39">289</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">Given the complex nature of this crime, it is recognized that its commission could involve more than one perpetrator as a part of a common criminal purpose.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p107 ft41"><SPAN class="ft39">290</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">It is understood that such deprivation of liberty may, in some circumstances, include</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 67px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft42">exacting forced labour or otherwise reducing a person to servile status as defined in the Supplementary Convention on the Abolition of Slavery, the Slave Trade, and Institutions and Practices Similar to Slavery of 1956. It is also understood that the conduct described in this element includes trafficking in persons, in particular women and children.</P>
<P class="p16 ft2">550</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_554" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">2. The perpetrator caused such person or persons to engage in one or</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">more acts of a sexual nature.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr17 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(xxii)-3</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of enforced prostitution</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p273 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator caused one or more persons to engage in one or more acts of a sexual nature by force, or by threat of force or coercion, such as that caused by fear of violence, duress, detention, psychological oppression or abuse of power, against such person or persons or another person, or by taking advantage of a coercive environment or such person’s or persons’ incapacity to give genuine consent.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p551 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator or another person obtained or expected to obtain pecuniary or other advantage in exchange for or in connection with the acts of a sexual nature.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p256 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(xxii)-4</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of forced pregnancy</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p314 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator confined one or more women forcibly made pregnant, with the intent of affecting the ethnic composition of any population or carrying out other grave violations of international law.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: right;padding-right: 51px;margin-top: 58px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">551</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_555" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 79px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 515px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr24 td182"><P class="p182 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(xxii)-5</NOBR></P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 rowspan=2 class="tr28 td182"><P class="p182 ft26">War crime of enforced sterilization</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr41 td165"><P class="p13 ft108">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr18 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr18 td182"><P class="p182 ft3">Elements</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr18 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr18 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">1.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr18 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator deprived one or more persons of biological</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr1 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr1 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">reproductive capacity.<SPAN class="ft32">291</SPAN></P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr1 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr1 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">2.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr1 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct was neither justified by the medical or hospital</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">treatment of the person or persons concerned nor carried out with their</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr24 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">genuine consent.<SPAN class="ft32">292</SPAN></P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr1 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr1 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">3.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr1 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">international armed conflict.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">4.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">the existence of an armed conflict.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 29px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) <NOBR>(xxii)-6</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of sexual violence</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">1. The perpetrator committed an act of a sexual nature against one or more persons or caused such person or persons to engage in an act of a sexual nature by force, or by threat of force or coercion, such as that caused by fear of violence, duress, detention, psychological oppression or abuse of power, against such person or persons or another person, or by taking advantage of a coercive environment or such person’s or persons’ incapacity to give genuine consent.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">2. The conduct was of a gravity comparable to that of a grave breach of the Geneva Conventions.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">3. The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established the gravity of the conduct.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">4. The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">5. The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 90px;margin-top: 82px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft39">291</SPAN><SPAN class="ft45">The deprivation is not intended to include </SPAN><NOBR>birth-control</NOBR> measures which have a non- permanent effect in practice.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft41"><SPAN class="ft39">292</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">It is understood that ”genuine consent” does not include consent obtained through</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46">deception.</P>
<P class="p522 ft2">552</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_556" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 49px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 68px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 556px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 3px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 411px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xxiii)</P>
<P class="p358 ft26">War crime of using protected persons as shields</P>
<P class="p106 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p907 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator moved or otherwise took advantage of the location of one or more civilians or other persons protected under the international law of armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator intended to shield a military objective from attack or shield, favour or impede military operations.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p905 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 145px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 28px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 624px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p317 ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xxiv)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 200px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft27">War crime of attacking objects or persons using the distinctive emblems of the Geneva Conventions</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 2px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p314 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator attacked one or more persons, buildings, medical units or transports or other objects using, in conformity with international law, a distinctive emblem or other method of identification indicating protection under the Geneva Conventions.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 158px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator intended such persons, buildings, units or transports or other objects so using such identification to be the object of the attack.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 30px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xxv)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of starvation as a method of warfare</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p273 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator deprived civilians of objects indispensable to their survival.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator intended to starve civilians as a method of warfare.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: right;padding-right: 51px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">553</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_557" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 515px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr2 td261"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr2 td5"><P class="p13 ft2">4. The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td261"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr17 td5"><P class="p13 ft2">the existence of an armed conflict.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (b) (xxvi)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of using, conscripting or enlisting children</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator conscripted or enlisted one or more persons into the national armed forces or used one or more persons to participate actively in hostilities.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">Such person or persons were under the age of 15 years.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator knew or should have known that such person or persons were under the age of 15 years.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an international armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 29px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (c)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (c) <NOBR>(i)-1</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of murder</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator killed one or more persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 15px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such person or persons were either </SPAN><SPAN class="ft33">hors de combat</SPAN>, or were civilians, medical personnel, or religious personnel<A href="#page_557"><SPAN class="ft137">293 </SPAN></A>taking no active part in the hostilities.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established this status.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an armed conflict not of an international character.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 74px;margin-top: 60px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft50">293 </SPAN>The term ”religious personnel” includes those <NOBR>non-confessional</NOBR> <NOBR>non-combatant</NOBR> military personnel carrying out a similar function.</P>
<P class="p1406 ft2">554</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_558" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 49px 0px 80px 68px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 556px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 556px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 3px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 411px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft23">Article 8 (2) (c) <NOBR>(i)-2</NOBR></P>
<P class="p358 ft26">War crime of mutilation</P>
<P class="p106 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p907 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator subjected one or more persons to mutilation, in particular by permanently disfiguring the person or persons, or by permanently disabling or removing an organ or appendage.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct was neither justified by the medical, dental or hospital treatment of the person or persons concerned nor carried out in such person’s or persons’ interests.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Such person or persons were either </SPAN><SPAN class="ft28">hors de combat</SPAN>, or were civilians, medical personnel or religious personnel taking no active part in the hostilities.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established this status.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an armed conflict not of an international character.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p848 ft23">Article 8 (2) (c) <NOBR>(i)-3</NOBR></P>
<P class="p91 ft26">War crime of cruel treatment</P>
<P class="p106 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p892 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator inflicted severe physical or mental pain or suffering upon one or more persons.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p134 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">Such person or persons were either </SPAN><SPAN class="ft3">hors de combat</SPAN>, or were</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">civilians, medical personnel, or religious personnel taking no active part in the hostilities.</P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established this status.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an armed conflict not of an international character.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 145px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 73px 0px 0px 485px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 71px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">555</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_559" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 515px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr24 td182"><P class="p182 ft23">Article 8 (2) (c) <NOBR>(i)-4</NOBR></P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 rowspan=2 class="tr28 td182"><P class="p182 ft26">War crime of torture</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr41 td165"><P class="p13 ft108">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr18 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr18 td182"><P class="p182 ft3">Elements</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr16 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr16 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">1.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr16 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator inflicted severe physical or mental pain or suffering</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">upon one or more persons.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr28 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">2.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator inflicted the pain or suffering for such purposes as:</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">obtaining information or a confession, punishment, intimidation or</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">coercion or for any reason based on discrimination of any kind.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">3.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">Such person or persons were either <SPAN class="ft3">hors de combat</SPAN>, or were</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">civilians, medical personnel or religious personnel taking no active part</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">in the hostilities.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">4.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">established this status.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">5.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">armed conflict not of an international character.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">6.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">the existence of an armed conflict.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 29px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (c) (ii)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of outrages upon personal dignity</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">1. The perpetrator humiliated, degraded or otherwise violated the dignity of one or more persons.<A href="#page_559"><SPAN class="ft137">294</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">2. The severity of the humiliation, degradation or other violation was of such degree as to be generally recognized as an outrage upon personal dignity.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">3. Such person or persons were either <SPAN class="ft33">hors de combat</SPAN>, or were civilians, medical personnel or religious personnel taking no active part in the hostilities.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">4. The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established this status.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">5. The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an armed conflict not of an international character.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 70px;margin-top: 18px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft50">294 </SPAN>For this crime, ”persons” can include dead persons. It is understood that the victim need not personally be aware of the existence of the humiliation or degradation or other violation. This element takes into account relevant aspects of the cultural background of the victim.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 8px;margin-top: 7px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">556</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_560" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 510px;margin-left: 68px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">6. The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td263"><P class="p13 ft2">the existence of an armed conflict.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr17 td63"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p256 ft23">Article 8 (2) (c) (iii)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of taking hostages</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p273 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator seized, detained or otherwise held hostage one or more persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator threatened to kill, injure or continue to detain such person or persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator intended to compel a State, an international organization, a natural or legal person or a group of persons to act or refrain from acting as an explicit or implicit condition for the safety or the release of such person or persons.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">Such person or persons were either </SPAN><SPAN class="ft33">hors de combat</SPAN>, or were civilians, medical personnel or religious personnel taking no active part in the hostilities.</P>
<P class="p551 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established this status.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an armed conflict not of an international character.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (c) (iv)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of sentencing or execution without due process</P>
<P class="p341 ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator passed sentence or executed one or more persons.</SPAN><A href="#page_560"><SPAN class="ft32">295</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 17px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Such person or persons were either </SPAN><SPAN class="ft28">hors de combat</SPAN>, or were civilians, medical personnel or religious personnel taking no active part in the hostilities.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established this status.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 193px;margin-top: 32px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft74"><SPAN class="ft94">295 </SPAN>The elements laid down in these documents do not address the different forms of individual criminal responsibility, as enunciated in articles 25 and 28 of the Statute.</P>
<P class="p645 ft2">557</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_561" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 50px 0px 80px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 515px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 1px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 122px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 393px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p134 ft2">4. There was no previous judgement pronounced by a court, or the court that rendered judgement was not ”regularly constituted”, that is, it did not afford the essential guarantees of independence and impartiality, or the court that rendered judgement did not afford all other judicial</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-top: 3px;margin-top: 3px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">guarantees generally recognized as indispensable under international law.<A href="#page_561"><SPAN class="ft32">296</SPAN></A></P>
<P class="p824 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator was aware of the absence of a previous judgement or of the denial of relevant guarantees and the fact that they are essential or indispensable to a fair trial.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an armed conflict not of an international character.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p824 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 44px 0px 0px 8px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 575px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p137 ft23">Article 8 (2) (e)</P>
<P class="p36 ft23">Article 8 (2) (e) (i)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of attacking civilians</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;margin-top: 5px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator directed an attack.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The object of the attack was a civilian population as such or individual civilians not taking direct part in hostilities.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator intended the civilian population as such or individual civilians not taking direct part in hostilities to be the object of the attack.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an armed conflict not of an international character.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 114px;padding-right: 72px;margin-top: 117px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46"><SPAN class="ft50">296 </SPAN>With respect to elements 4 and 5, the Court should consider whether, in the light of all relevant circumstances, the cumulative effect of factors with respect to guarantees deprived the person or persons of a fair trial.</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">558</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_562" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 49px 0px 80px 68px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 556px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 556px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 3px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 411px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft23">Article 8 (2) (e) (ii)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-right: 55px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft27">War crime of attacking objects or persons using the distinctive emblems of the Geneva Conventions</P>
<P class="p414 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p907 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator attacked one or more persons, buildings, medical units or transports or other objects using, in conformity with international law, a distinctive emblem or other method of identification indicating protection under the Geneva Conventions.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 17px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft38"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 12px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator intended such persons, buildings, units or transports or other objects so using such identification to be the object of the attack.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an armed conflict not of an international character.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p848 ft23">Article 8 (2) (e) (iii)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-right: 84px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft27">War crime of attacking personnel or objects involved in a humanitarian assistance or peacekeeping mission</P>
<P class="p414 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p904 ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator directed an attack.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p892 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The object of the attack was personnel, installations, material, units or vehicles involved in a humanitarian assistance or peacekeeping mission in accordance with the Charter of the United Nations.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator intended such personnel, installations, material, units or vehicles so involved to be the object of the attack.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">Such personnel, installations, material, units or vehicles were entitled to that protection given to civilians or civilian objects under the international law of armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p905 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of the factual circumstances that established that protection.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an armed conflict not of an international character.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 145px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 77px 0px 0px 485px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 71px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">559</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_563" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 79px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style="width: 515px;font: 13px 'Times New Roman';">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr24 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr24 td182"><P class="p182 ft23">Article 8 (2) (e) (iv)</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 rowspan=2 class="tr25 td182"><P class="p182 ft26">War crime of attacking protected objects<A href="#page_563"><SPAN style="font: bold 9px 'Times New Roman';line-height: 12px;position: relative; bottom: 6px;">297</SPAN></A></P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr27 td165"><P class="p13 ft55">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr17 td182"><P class="p182 ft3">Elements</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr16 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr16 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">1.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr16 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator directed an attack.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">2.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The object of the attack was one or more buildings dedicated to</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">religion, education, art, science or charitable purposes, historic</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">monuments, hospitals or places where the sick and wounded are</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr5 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">collected, which were not military objectives.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">3.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator intended such building or buildings dedicated to</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">religion, education, art, science or charitable purposes, historic</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">monuments, hospitals or places where the sick and wounded are</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">collected, which were not military objectives, to be the object of the</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">attack.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">4.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr5 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">armed conflict not of an international character.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr28 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">5.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr28 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr5 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">the existence of an armed conflict.</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 28px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft23">Article 8 (2) (e) (v)</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 11px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of pillaging</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">1. The perpetrator appropriated certain property.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 2px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22">2. The perpetrator intended to deprive the owner of the property and to appropriate it for private or personal use.<A href="#page_563"><SPAN class="ft137">298</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">3. The appropriation was without the consent of the owner.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 16px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">4. The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an armed conflict not of an international character.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 68px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft4">5. The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;padding-right: 79px;margin-top: 119px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft74"><SPAN class="ft39">297</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">The presence in the locality of persons specially protected under the Geneva Conventions of 1949 or of police forces retained for the sole purpose of maintaining law and order does not by itself render the locality a military objective.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft39">298</SPAN><SPAN class="ft75">As indicated by the use of the term ”private or personal use”, appropriations justified by</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 122px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft46">military necessity cannot constitute the crime of pillaging.</P>
<P class="p522 ft2">560</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_564" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 49px 0px 80px 0px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 624px;">


<DIV style="border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 68px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 556px;overflow: hidden;">
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 3px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 411px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft23">Article 8 (2) (e) <NOBR>(vi)-1</NOBR></P>
<P class="p358 ft26">War crime of rape</P>
<P class="p106 ft3">Elements</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;padding-top: 3px;margin-top: 4px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The perpetrator invaded</SPAN><A href="#page_564"><SPAN class="ft32">299 </SPAN></A>the body of a person by conduct resulting in penetration, however slight, of any part of the body of the victim or of the perpetrator with a sexual organ, or of the anal or genital opening of the victim with any object or any other part of the body.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 15px;">The invasion was committed by force, or by threat of force or coercion, such as that caused by fear of violence, duress, detention, psychological oppression or abuse of power, against such person or another person, or by taking advantage of a coercive environment, or the</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;padding-top: 3px;margin-top: 3px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft2">invasion was committed against a person incapable of giving genuine consent.<A href="#page_564"><SPAN class="ft32">300</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-right: 18px;margin-top: 13px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an armed conflict not of an international character.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV style="float:left;border:none;margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 145px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p16 ft2">Prop. 2013/14:146</P>
<P class="p414 ft2">Bilaga 7</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV style="border:none;margin: 28px 0px 0px 0px;padding: 0px;border:none;width: 624px;overflow: hidden;">
<P class="p317 ft23">Article 8 (2) (e) <NOBR>(vi)-2</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 10px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft26">War crime of sexual slavery<A href="#page_564"><SPAN style="font: bold 9px 'Times New Roman';line-height: 12px;position: relative; bottom: 6px;">301</SPAN></A></P>
<P class="p641 ft3">Elements</P>
<P class="p47 ft4"><SPAN class="ft2">1.</SPAN><SPAN style="font: 13px 'Times New Roman';margin-left: 18px;line-height: 16px;">The perpetrator exercised any or all of the powers attaching to the right of ownership over one or more persons, such as by purchasing,</SPAN></P>
<P class="p312 ft2">selling, lending or bartering such a person or persons, or by imposing on them a similar deprivation of liberty.<A href="#page_564"><SPAN class="ft32">302</SPAN></A></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 1px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator caused such person or persons to engage in one or more acts of a sexual nature.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The conduct took place in the context of and was associated with an armed conflict not of an international character.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 163px;margin-top: 12px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft22"><SPAN class="ft2">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft193">The perpetrator was aware of factual circumstances that established the existence of an armed conflict.</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;margin-top: 14px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft41"><SPAN class="ft39">299</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The concept of ”invasion” is intended to be broad enough to be </SPAN><NOBR>gender-neutral.</NOBR></P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 170px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft44"><SPAN class="ft39">300</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">It is understood that a person may be incapable of giving genuine consent if affected by natural, induced or </SPAN><NOBR>age-related</NOBR> incapacity. This footnote also applies to the corresponding elements in article 8 (2) (e) <NOBR>(vi)-3,</NOBR> 5 and 6.</P>
<P style="text-align: justify;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 189px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft42"><SPAN class="ft39">301</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">Given the complex nature of this crime, it is recognized that its commission could involve more than one perpetrator as a part of a common criminal purpose.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p644 ft41"><SPAN class="ft39">302</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">It is understood that such deprivation of liberty may, in some circumstances, include</SPAN></P>
<P style="text-align: left;padding-left: 68px;padding-right: 162px;margin-top: 0px;margin-bottom: 0px;" class="ft42">exacting forced labour or otherwise reducing a person to servile status as defined in the Supplementary Convention on the Abolition of Slavery, the Slave Trade, and Institutions and Practices Similar to Slavery of 1956. It is also understood that the conduct described in this element includes trafficking in persons, in particular women and children.</P>
<P class="p645 ft2">561</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_565" style="position:relative; overflow: hidden;margin: 47px 0px 80px 41px;padding: 0px;border: none;width: 583px;">

	<TD class="tr5 td165"><P class="p13 ft2">Bilaga 7</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 rowspan=2 class="tr28 td182"><P class="p182 ft26">War crime of enforced prostitution</P></TD>
</TR>

	<TD class="tr41 td165"><P class="p13 ft108">&nbsp;</P></TD>
</TR>

	<TD class="tr18 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>

</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr16 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr16 td103"><P class="p182 ft2">1.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr16 td197"><P class="p135 ft2">The perpetrator caused one or more persons to engage in one or</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td165"><P class="p13 ft5">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td182"><P class="p182 ft2">more acts of a sexual nature by force, or by threat of force or coercion,</P></TD>
</TR>
